meanings.definition: To surpass in energetic activity or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: She was outhustling her classmates in the race, running faster and smarter.
meanings.sent2: The young entrepreneur was outhustling her competitors with her innovative ideas.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outhustling the other animals in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The determined student was outhustling procrastination to finish her homework on time.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah was outhustling its prey, swiftly closing in for the kill.

meanings.definition: To outdo in competition or business dealings.
meanings.sent1: He was outhustling his opponent in the chess match, making strategic moves.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious salesperson was outhustling her colleagues to reach the top of the leaderboard.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was outhustling the other animals in the forest to get the best food.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete was outhustling his own limits, pushing himself to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The skilled negotiator was outhustling the competition, sealing the deal with finesse.
